properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: An area of thunderstorms south of the international border is moving northward and is expected to reach southwestern interior, the Central and East Fraser Valley early this evening. These thunderstorms may be capable of producing strong wind gusts, large hail and heavy rain. ### Weather in the mountains can change suddenly resulting in hazardous driving conditions. Severe thunderstorm watches are issued when atmospheric conditions are favourable for the development of thunderstorms that could produce one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall. Road conditions are available at www.drivebc.ca. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to BCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #BCStorm.
Expires: 2019-06-27T07:24:53-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-06-26T22:46:53-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2853696306.2019
Area: Highway 3 - Hope to Princeton via Allison Pass, Coquihalla Highway - Hope to Merritt, Coquihalla Highway - Merritt to Kamloops, Okanagan Connector - Merritt to Kelowna

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Conditions are favourable for the development of severe thunderstorms that may be capable of producing strong wind gusts, large hail and heavy rain. Thunderstorms are expected to continue into the evening hours. As thunderstorms develop, the severe thunderstorm watch may be expanded to surrounding areas. ### Large hail can damage property and cause injury. Strong wind gusts can toss loose objects, damage weak buildings, break branches off trees and overturn large vehicles. Heavy downpours can cause flash floods and water pooling on roads. Severe thunderstorm watches are issued when atmospheric conditions are favourable for the development of thunderstorms that could produce one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ABstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ABStorm.
Expires: 2019-06-27T05:59:03-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-06-27T00:22:03-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1797182888.2019

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: At 5:59 p.m. EDT, Environment Canada meteorologists are tracking a severe thunderstorm capable of producing very strong wind gusts, up to nickel size hail and heavy rain. This severe thunderstorm is located 10 kilometres west of Winchester, moving east at 40 km/h. Primary threats include 2 cm hail and heavy downpours. Locations impacted include: Winchester and Hallville. ### Large hail can damage property and cause injury. Severe thunderstorm warnings are issued when imminent or occurring thunderstorms are likely to produce or are producing one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall.
Expires: 2019-06-27T00:58:32-00:00

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: At 5:08 p.m. MDT, Environment Canada meteorologists are tracking a severe thunderstorm capable of producing up to nickel size hail and heavy rain. At 5:08 p.m. MDT, Environment Canada meteorologists are tracking a cluster of severe thunderstorms capable of producing up to nickel size hail and heavy rain. These thunderstorms are located between Wabamum Lake and Spruce Grove and is slowly moving northward. The main threat with these thunderstorms is heavy rain. ### Heavy downpours can cause flash floods and water pooling on roads. Severe thunderstorm warnings are issued when imminent or occurring thunderstorms are likely to produce or are producing one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall.

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: At 6:44 p.m. EDT, Environment Canada meteorologists are tracking a severe thunderstorm capable of producing very strong wind gusts and up to nickel size hail. This line of severe thunderstorms is located from 65 kilometres northeast of Gardiner to 25 kilometres southwest of Hunta, moving southeast at 85 km/h. Severe thunderstorms will be near: Abitibi around 6:55 PM EDT. Locations impacted include: Cochrane, Abitibi, Iroquois Falls, Potter, Tunis and Dunning. ### Strong wind gusts can toss loose objects, damage weak buildings, break branches off trees and overturn large vehicles. Severe thunderstorm warnings are issued when imminent or occurring thunderstorms are likely to produce or are producing one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall.
Expires: 2019-06-27T00:34:30-00:00

Description: At 6:21 p.m. EDT, Environment Canada meteorologists are tracking a severe thunderstorm capable of producing very strong wind gusts, up to nickel size hail and heavy rain. A thunderstorm affecting the Voyageur Provincial Park to St-Eugene areas will move east of the region into Quebec by 7:00 P.M. EDT. Primary threats include heavy downpours and 2 cm hail. ### Large hail can damage property and cause injury. Severe thunderstorm warnings are issued when imminent or occurring thunderstorms are likely to produce or are producing one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall.
